subjects.subject: machine learning and deep learning for remote sensing

metadata.title: Training samples dataset
metadata.description:
Training samples resource.

Usage context

To train the classification algorithm used to generate the deforestation map, in the "Detecting deforestation using data cubes and deep learning", a Deep Learning (DL) model was trained. 

To train the DL model, a training sample dataset was used. This dataset consists of 480 samples collected from Sentinel-2/MSI images covering the state of Rondonia. The samples are intended to detect deforestation events, so each sample instance is associated with one of the following classes: (i) Forest; (ii) Burned Area; (iii) Cleared Area; and (iv) Highly Degraded. Each sample is associated with a time-series extracted from Sentinel-2/MSI imagery, covering a set of 29 dates with a period of 16 days, ranging from June 04, 2020, to August 26, 2021. Twelve attributes are available for each sample, standing for time-series Sentinel-2/MSI of bands (Bands 02, 03, 04, 05, 06, 08, 8A, 11, and 12) and vegetation indices (NDVI, EVI, and NBR). 

This sample dataset is available in the sitsdata R package, provided by the sits development team.

Files

The sample files are available in the following file formats:

  • samples_prodes_4classes.csv: Training samples in CSV format, with location (Longitude, Latitude), date (Start Date, End Date) and class (label);
  • samples_prodes_4classes.rds: Training samples in RDS format, with location (Longitude, Latitude), date (Start Date, End Date), class (label), and time series. This file contains the original time-series extracted from the Sentinel-2/MSI data cube. Using it, you are able to train new deforestation classification models;

Accessing the dataset

You can download the sample dataset in the section below. Also, you can access it using the following link: https://github.com/e-sensing/sitsdata
